alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Highlands (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 5:12PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Ferry and eastern Okanogan Counties through 545 PM PDT... At 512 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 24 miles northwest of Sherman Pass, or 45 miles northeast of Omak, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ferry, Toroda, and Curlew Lake State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
